The bike is smooth and reacts to my increase in cadence very quickly. No lag.

reviews.content:
Overall a great device! Love the customization options, so that I can test out many settings. Only downsize is that is really not silent, there is a constant turbo noise and at some speeds I get some clicking noise as well. Not sure if this is because of the reconditioned state. 
+1: I miss the software option to use steering buttons change the course in ZWIFT.

reviews.content: Overall pretty good. Hoods keep sliding down during rides so we added some tape to the stem which has helped some. Also, bike didn’t come with any pedals at all, so grabbed some off another bike for now. Expected better for 4K! Hopefully the bike holds up over time!
reviews.title: Pretty good

bike.name: bike

reviews.content:
I only have a few rides so far, but overall impression is that the bike is good. Easy to set up. Much quieter than the direct drive kickr. Large range of adjustments to accommodate any fit. Solid construction. Only issue I see is that the handle bar height adjustment clamp doesn’t get tight enough to prevent them slipping down when out of the saddle. I’m sure I’ll be able to resolve it, but if not then it goes from annoying to a significant issue. I’ve heard that this is a known problem. 

Things to know: Handle bar tape is very thin. Plan to replace it with something thicker. Saddle is a personal thing, so expect to swap the one supplied out. Shipping is terrible. It took 3 weeks for mine to arrive with 2.5 weeks being already in my city. I assumed that “special handling” was because the final delivery needed to set up the bike for you and that was what caused the delay. It wasn’t they just dropped the box off.
reviews.title: Quality bike. Terrible shipping.

reviews.content:
The construction is solid and the gradient changes makes for a near outdoor riding experience. The ability to adjust the fitting to your preferred riding style or existing bike bike is a plus. I did have a problem adjusting the hoods, because the hex screws appear to be machine tightened and I had to order the ParkTool Ball Hex wrench to avoid stripping the screws. 

When I received the hex wrench to adjust the hoods, I needed to adjust the bar tape. The tape was applied with a heavy glue and had to be removed with alcohol and heavy rubbing. At that point, I was frustrated and replaced the bars.

My other concern is the feel and reaction of the drivetrain. When making quick gear changes to sprint up a climb or just a hard dig, I feel a slip in the drivetrain or a slow response while quickly ramping up the power. 

Overall I’m satisfied with the purchase, but feel at that price point, I should not have to purchase specialty hex tools and waste over an hour removing glue from the bar tape.
reviews.title: ROI is Questionable

reviews.content: The bike has worked well so far. It makes Zwift more fun and immersive. I like not having to worry about tire pressure or spinning out when applying sudden power (as with my wheel-on trainer). It shines when I'm applying more power, such as when doing sprints in Zwift. For this, it is so much sturdier than my old setup. I'm hoping this will last for years but it's complexity makes me a bit worried about that prospect. I haven't been able to find a way to use resistance mode with Trainerroad yet which is disappointing as I expected that I would have this option.
reviews.title: Solid training platform

reviews.content:
Overall I'm happy with the reconditioned unit I received. The only way to tell the unit had previously been used was the 'damage' around the 172.5 pedal inserts.

I am however happy I bought it at a greatly reduced price because at full price I would have kind of felt ripped off. At full price I'd expect a perfect product and it's good but definitely not perfect.

The bike makes some strange & annoying mechanical (whining kinda) noises at certain cadances. I'm not sure if my unit is faulty but from reading arround on the internet this is kind of normal.
Also in ERG mode there's some fishy things going on. I'm not a fan of the artificial power smoothing Wahoo uses but next to that ERG mode seems to fail at hitting the correct power target and always drifts off to a value a few % below what the target should be. It's not a massive problem but something I never encountered on my previously trainer and something that should never happen on a trainer at this price point. Reconditioned or otherwise.
reviews.title: Okay but there's room for improvement

reviews.content: I read many reviews of reconditioned bikes where people said their bikes looked new and even came in original packaging, so i took a leap of faith and purchased the reconditioned bike. I was not so lucky, my bike does have visible cosmetic wear and can tell they parted together pieces from multiple bikes because different pieces of the bike have different levels of visible wear. It stings even more that wahoo is now selling the NEW V1 bike for the same price I paid for a reconditioned V1 bike 4-5 weeks ago, their marketing ploys are sophisticated and they will not have both NEW and Reconditioned V1 bikes on their website for sale at the same time; they bounce between which one is listed for sale trying to get you to think they are sold out of New ones, then poof the new ones are back listed for sale.
reviews.title: Can tell it’s used but bike works

reviews.content: Better than expected. However, at this point, I'd probably give a 4.5 versus a 5-star. Maybe it has a chance to become a 5. Since I have been riding on it, I do enjoy my Zwift rides more than I had in the past using Kickr (2019 model) on my Aethos (Specialized) bike. A few features I appreciate are: In you're setup, you can select from multiple group sets based on your riding experience, including the cassette and crank lengths. The bike can be set up for multiple profiles pretty easily. The Wahoo app has the ability to create a fit based on your road bike for the best comfort; although it was a miss for me, I performed my own fit. I also appreciate the auto (or manual) tilt for grade percentages and the ability to steer into corners. A big plus is it is much quieter than the Kickr models, and I don't have to perform a calibration. "For me" I would pay a bit more for better handlebars. I was able to purchase this on a Black Friday sale at almost half the regular price; therefore, this has been a great purchase. If I did not dislike virtual rides so much this could be a 5-star.
reviews.title: Almost a 5 Star. It's Just Me.

reviews.content: I have enjoyed my new Kickr bike. For years, I trained on an old-school gym style trainer that was very heavy and solid with the heavy fly wheel. The first adjustment to the kickr bike was that it is not as stable. It has taken getting used to particularly when I stand up and really mash on it. I feel the bike could be a little more stable. The thing I enjoy most is the integration. I’ve never trained with a power meter and I like that I can go on wahoo and Zwift and other training apps, and have all of my data integrated. I have trained on my bike now three times and I like it more each time. I would recommend it!
reviews.title: Integrated Training at its best

bike.name: bike
bike.sentence: I feel the bike could be a little more stable.

reviews.content: Just purchased a reconditioned Kickr bike for myself after buying one earlier in the year for my wife. Once you ride one of these it's tough to go back to the traditional setup. A couple of things held me back from a 5 star. The head tube and seat tube did not have the friction paste applied like the new one did. The power supply that shipped with the unit was defective so Wahoo did not test the bike with the shipped power supply. I believe Wahoo should be a little better with these reconditioned devices before shipping
reviews.title: Reconditioned Kickr Bike

reviews.content:
Very solid platform. Have to say it is imperative to get things very very tight to prevent sounds coming from the bike. But once tightened very very tight. It performs well. I went from a kikr V5 to the full kikr bike V1. On Erg mode it feels a bit smoother although it seems to ramp up quicker than the kikr V5. Increasing cadence happens faster it seems. Still getting used to self adjusting cadences without surging them too much 
 I did break the seatpost quick release lever that clamps and holds the seatpost because I adjusted it so tight. Replaced the quick release with a bolt and nut .
 220 lb guy here so had to make things rather firm on all clamps.
 Just two rides in now. Time will tell. But so far. I’m happy with the purchase 
 Cheers ☕️
reviews.title: Wahoo Kikr Bike V1

reviews.content: Overall the bike was easy to set up. The build compared to the Garmin Tacx bike, which I also have in my research lab, is less solid feeling initially, with lower quality handle bars. However, according to our research subjects, when riding, it is more forgiving on 60-120 minute rides according to our research subjects. The change in grade when going negative feels very unnatural compared to the road, especially when it is below -2% grade. The inclines feel more natural. Responsiveness in erg mode feels smooth with all the programs we use in our lab. It would be nice to have a full aero bar set-up option that could be quickly changed. In our laboratory, we work with both road cyclists and triathletes on most days. Finally, the rider position adjustments are much more precise than our Tacx bike.
reviews.title: New Research Lab Bike Thoughts

With enough fans blowing it feels really close to riding a real bike outside. The saddle was not a good fit for me but the fact you can customize saddle and bars on this trainer is awesome. reviews.content:
Overall I would say my experience to date with the bike has been excellent.

Primary Reason: The ride experience has been terrific! The bike is very stable, changes resistance quickly, and tilt changes are smooth. I would recommend the Kickr Bike. 

A few other notes:
- Delivery, unboxing and basic assembly is an easy process
- Bike set up with Bike Fit wizard in the app gets it to good starting position and then some tweaking of the adjustment points to dial it in are easy.
- A lot of options to configure gearing to reflect groupset configuration (I matched it to my road bike)
- Smooth setup and use with Zwift, TrainerRoad, and RGT.
 
A final note I think worthy to mention:
- The flywheel is louder than expected. It is not loud but it may be louder than my Kickr Core but have not done any side by side comparison. It is not an impact to riding but noticeable at times.
reviews.title: Kickr Bike Review after roughly 6 months

- Bike set up with Bike Fit wizard in the app gets it to good starting position and then some tweaking of the adjustment points to dial it in are easy.

reviews.content:
Excellent dedicated indoor bike trainer for Zwift. Takes up less room than a turbo trainer + bike combo, and means you can keep your bike ready for outdoor rides, if you do those.

Relatively easy to set up. I had a bike fit but unfortunately not one supported by Wahoo app, so went down the route of taking a picture of my outdoor bike to get approximate settings, which I have now tweaked.

Once set up, connects to Zwift very easily and quickly every time. Fairly quiet in usage apart from a high-pitched whistle from the fly wheel, but still quieter than a bike chain on a turbo trainer, and easily ignored when listening to music.

I love the grade simulation - actually physically angling the bike up or down as well as the resistance, according to what's happening in Zwift. A bit annoying that I have to remember to 'unlock' the grade simulation every time I log in to Zwift, however. Wish it wouldn't keep resetting.

Only thing I would like on this bike is the road feel that I used to get from my Tacx Neo. I'm surprised at how much I miss the feel of riding over cobbles or gravel in Zwift – I now realise how much of a physical cue that was to me putting in more effort to keep my speed up as well as making Zwift more immersive.
reviews.title: Great bike for Zwift that takes up less room than a bike + turbo combo

simulation.sentence: I love the grade simulation - actually physically angling the bike up or down as well as the resistance, according to what's happening in Zwift.

option.sentence: And why not have a option of a clamp on tablet holder that goes up and down as the bike goes up and down.

reviews.content: The Kickr bike is a nice convenience compared to setting up the outdoor bike to the trainer. The incline takes some getting to used and is subtle if you're not sure what to expect. The shifting levers are nice and do replicate normal shifting pretty closely. If you're looking for the same feel as an outdoor bike on a trainer, this is not it. It gets pretty darn close though. The most significant win is the convenience of not having to set up my road bike on the trainer. Also, it's obviously much cleaner than an outdoor bike. I also like that it barely emits any noise.
reviews.title: Close to road bike feel but not exact.

reviews.content: Solid build quality and easy to setup. Seat post clamp seems difficult to close properly to maintain height! Wiped of the grease and hope that helps! ERG mode on 1st w/o was strange with grinding to a halt at high watt interval and was down to the easiest gear to maintain 90rpm @ 90% FTP for longer 10min interval! Smooth and quiet, like it but perhaps I need more time to dial it in properly!

reviews.content:
I am happy with the purchase of the KICKR Bike. It's manufactured to handle the rigors of hard riding, and it feels like a real bike. I enjoy riding it and setting new times and increasing my power outputs. I like how you can match it up with the WahooFit App to see all the numbers. 
The only issue I have is that I wish Wahoo would have mentioned that smaller riders may have a fitment issue. And the KICKR bike may not be the right KICKR product. I bought the KICKR bike mainly for my wife, but I feel it's slightly too big, and she can't get the best benefits from it. Plus, I want her like it so that she rides it more; instead of hating it because it's not the correct riding position.
reviews.title: Pleased, but slightly unhappy

reviews.content:
Great bike, definately a huge improvement Over my last one. I love to connect it to Zwift, however some things could be more intuitive, the up and down in ERG mode seems not always to work 100%. Then the the wahoo app and the Element app for my roam, why are there two apps needed? 
The assembly and setup was easy (once I had carried the heavy box into the appartment). 
I’m looking forward to further improvements, maybe spare parts like thicker handlebar, maybe with steering option for more realistic feeling, a wahoo rocker plate, as the saddle and bike is pretty stiff… and looking forward to my winter training and improvements through short units in the a.m. - a smart bike is the most important bike of all
reviews.title: Good with room for creative improvements

reviews.content:
This is a really good bike that's almost great. Setting it up is quick and it's easy to dial the fit in. The wahoo app got remarkably close. The ride is awesome, very smooth and responsive. The interaction with Zwift is flawless.

A few nits:

The bar diameter is remarkably small, a fatter bar would be more comfortable.

The quick releases that secure the saddle and bars need to be replaced with bolts. I have to crank them seriously hard to so that the bars and saddle don't slide around, especially during sprints.

I haven't had any problem with the cables from the bars, but a lot of my teammates have had issues with shifting eventually breaking due to corrosion on the connections.

I would expect that with just a few tweaks this would be a solid 5 star smart bike.
reviews.title: Almost awesome

reviews.content:
I would have rated this at 5* from the beginning had both clamps (seatpost and handlebars) worked from the beginning but both of my arrived broken. After a quick conversation with Wahoos customer service they had two new ones sent to me. As Tom Petty sang, the waiting is the hardest part. 

Since getting the Kickr Bike I have fallen in love with it. It rides amazing. Really lets you dial in your fit. Erg mode is so fast to kick in. Both TR and Zwift function perfectly. I love using this so much more than my own bike on a Kickr. I am so happy I pulled the trigger to order this.
reviews.title: Love using this

set.name: set
set.sentence: Erg mode is so fast to kick in.

use.name: use
use.sentence: I love using this so much more than my own bike on a Kickr.

reviews.content:
This bike has revolutionised my indoor cycling experience and I wouldn't be without it now.

However for the money I feel there are some issues that should already be addressed.


The quick release clamps are woefully inadequate. There are cheap aftermarket alternatives that do a far better job of preventing seat and handle bar slippage. If there are better aftermarket products then it'd hard to understand why or how Wahoo continues with the current solution.

The quality of the build was poor. Some of the screws holding the plastic covers in place were loose an none of them had been tightened to a specific torque. The result was awful rattles at various flywheel speeds. This again is easily fixed by ensuring the build team work to an OP and the QA team test the OP has been adhered to.

I'm fortunate that I am able to assess engineering faults and easily remedy them. Many others are not and these simple issues will result in a very poor experience. 

I logged a fault call for the above and was immediately offered a replacement bike. Many folk applaud this as an exemplary service. However I do not agree. Bike swap outs cost money and are a nuisance that should only be used as a last resort. 
The cost ultimately has to be covered by the purchase price. So the rather lazy practice of just reaching straight for a swap out is costing all of us money.

Please take the above points as constructive critic that would, in my opinion, move a great product to an outstanding product.
